column4: hello, someone know how to search for text in files using the terminal?
grep
oh ofcourse
not exactly but you really want to search / for text?  That will take a long time:  grep -R foobar /

here's the problem: I've installed something called like 'aquamarine', and have uninstalled it... but now, there's a new option in beryl, an option to switch in KDE mode, but I'm just using Beryl/Gnome... So Im searching for a config file to remove this extra option in Beryl
I would search ~/.beryl first.  Then whatever the system directory for beryl plugins is
ok
all local user settings should be
but I switched to another user, and there it was also, the new option
so I thought... maybe its not in the home folder
yeah you're probably right, but search inside the beryl folders, not all of /
or if you ask #beryl, they might know exactly where you need to go
thnx, I'll do that :)
problem dissolved :) I had to un-install kwin... ;)
did you try resetting your password?
yes I tried it
I even made it a password like 12345
I did sudo passwrd to change, I have to do passwrd, lets try again :)
yes, i can login again :)
